required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Pharmacokinetic Study Of GW679769 In Subjects With Renal Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Non-Randomized, Pharmacokinetic and Safety Study of Multiple Oral Doses of GW679769 in Subjects With Renal Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate how subjects with mild or moderate kidney problems process or breakdown the study drug GW679769 in their bodies as compared to healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma drug concentration versus time curve from 0 to 24 hours (AUC[0-24]) of casopitant and GSK525060
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 16 hours on Day 1; pre-dose on Day 2, Day 3 and Day 4; Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 36, and 48 hours on Day 5
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected at the indicated time points for pharmacokinetic analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed concentration (Cmax) of casopitant and GSK525060
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 16 hours on Day 1; pre-dose on Day 2, Day 3 and Day 4; Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 36, and 48 hours on Day 5
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected at the indicated time points for pharmacokinetic analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum observed plasma drug concentration (Tmax) of casopitant and GSK525060
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 16 hours on Day 1; pre-dose on Day 2, Day 3 and Day 4; Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 36, and 48 hours on Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected at the indicated time points for pharmacokinetic analysis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 16 hours on Day 1; pre-dose on Day 2, Day 3 and Day 4; Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 36, and 48 hours on Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected at the indicated time points for pharmacokinetic analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Free fraction (percent unbound) of casopitant and GSK525060
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1,2,4 and 24 hours post-dose on Day 1; pre-dose,1,2,4 and 24 hours post-dose on Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for assessment of protein binding of casopitant and GSK525060.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product. Any untoward event resulting in death, life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect or any other situation according to medical or scientific judgment will be categorized as SAE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with abnormal values for blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic (SBP) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP) will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with abnormal values for heart rate
Number of subjects with abnormal findings after weight measurement
secondary_outcome.description: Weight evaluation will be performed as measure of safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects having abnormal hematology laboratory parameters as a measure of safety
secondary_outcome.description: Hematology parameters will be analyzed as a measure of safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects having abnormal clinical Chemistry laboratory parameters as a measure of safety
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical chemistry parameters will be analyzed as a measure of safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects having abnormal values for urinalysis as a measure of safety
secondary_outcome.description: Urinalysis will be carried out as a measure of safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with abnormal findings after serological tests
secondary_outcome.description: Serological tests will be performed as a measure of safety.

arm_group.description: Eligible subjects will receive a 100 milligrams oral dose of casopitant once daily for five consecutive days.

intervention.description: Casopitant oral tablets will be available with a dose of 50 milligrams.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Healthy or have mild or moderate renal impairment.
- Females must be of non-childbearing potential(hysterectomy, bilateral oophorectomy, post-menopausal) OR childbearing and must have a negative pregnancy test and meet/comply with one of the following: abstinence, double-barrier contraception, vasectomized partner).
- Be negative for Hepatitis B and C.
- Have negative results on drug, alcohol and HIV tests.
- Have stable renal function.
Exclusion criteria:
- Have a peptic ulcer.
- Abuse drugs or alcohol.
- Are pregnant or lactating.
- Have heart failure.
- Have uncontrolled emesis.
- Have an infection.
- Have taken or received inducers or inhibitors of CYP3A4 or CYP3A5 within 14 days of study start.
- Active peptic ulcer disease.
- Digoxin use.
- Laboratory results that show low iron or pepsinogen levels, AST and CK level >1,5 ULN, or that show stool is positive for occult blood.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.
Results for study NKT102783 can be found on the GSK Clinical Study Register.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.
